Dear Bromor
Harold and I had a brainstorm that maybe it would be a
good idea for the NAEB PR committee to line up " contact people’* at
universities sponsoring summer workshops (as listed in the Newsletter).
These contact people would then distribute to the attendees NAEB
propaganda, such as Fast Sheet indexes (from which we get a number of
orders for Fact Sheets themselves), our membership flyers, and other
brochures.
We would ship the needed items from here to the contact person.
What do you think?
Now to Hank Mamet's very excellent letteri The community workshops
idea I leave for someone wiser in the field than I. I honestly don't
know whether it would do much for the NASB or not.
Yes, we have the descriptive brochure he mentions—a quite small,
easily read thing. I enclose a copy in case you haven't seen it or have
forgotten it.
Awards I tend to agree with you on...and without a lot of work, this in
itself wouldn't stimulate too much interest in the NAEB, in my opinion.
For the "special” magazine we're issuing in September, do you think
there is anyone who could do a better article on station promotion than
was done by you in the booklet—or even one half as good? Also, the
article by Tom Petry back in the March-Aprll, 1960, Journal. If you
have any ideas along that line, I'd like to Investigate the possibili¬
ties. Best regards.
(Mrs) Be e
Publications Editor
